summary: Comprehensive backend testing of DXY Walk-Forward Validation A3.5 module completed. 90% pass rate (18/20 tests). Core functionality working well with excellent idempotency and resolution rates. Two minor issues identified: invalid date handling and date processing capacity.

validation_bugs.issue: Accepts invalid date formats without returning 400 error
validation_bugs.impact: API should validate date format and return proper error codes

performance_limitations.issue: Only processed 105 dates vs requirement of >=500 dates
performance_limitations.symptoms: Date range 2018-2019 with 7-day steps yields insufficient processing
performance_limitations.impact: May not meet acceptance criteria for date processing volume
performance_limitations.workaround: Use longer date ranges or smaller step sizes

passed_tests: All 4 main API endpoints accessible and functional
Perfect idempotency (0 duplicates on repeated requests)
Proper error handling for missing parameters
Data persistence and CRUD operations working

critical_fixes: Increase date processing capacity to meet >=500 dates requirement - consider expanding date ranges or optimizing data availability checks
minor_fixes: Add proper date format validation in API endpoints to return 400 for invalid dates
verification_needed: Confirm if 105 processed dates meets business requirements or if system needs more historical data
